English: to come near to each other
a gift of food to someone
to sharpen and whet a knife
belt for fixing the saddle, root, blue
a k. of basket for vegetables
an animal of the rat family
to pay respect, to turn back
an angle from the main road
a louse or tick full of blood
a gift without a return gift
to climb up a small valley
a bird like the turtle dove
put a kid to a different milch, to bore through
tails and ears of a cushion
